name: Zolpidem Extended-Release
summary: Zolpidem CR is a non-benzodiazepine hypnotic for the short-term treatment of insomnia, formulated for both sleep initiation and maintenance.
description: Zolpidem tartrate extended-release, marketed as Ambien CR, is a sedative-hypnotic indicated for the short-term treatment of insomnia characterized by difficulties with sleep initiation and/or maintenance. It has a biphasic release mechanism—an initial layer to promote sleep onset, followed by a slower release to maintain sleep. Like immediate-release zolpidem, it selectively binds to the benzodiazepine site of the alpha1-containing GABA-A receptor, enhancing inhibitory neurotransmission. Lower doses are recommended for women and older adults to minimize next-day impairment.

off_label_uses: Middle-of-the-night awakenings (not FDA-approved for this use)
contraindications: History of complex sleep behaviors (e.g., sleepwalking) after zolpidem use
Hypersensitivity to zolpidem or formulation components

items: Short-term treatment of insomnia characterized by difficulties with sleep initiation and/or maintenance

sections.text: Binds selectively to the benzodiazepine site of the alpha1-containing GABA-A receptor, enhancing inhibitory neurotransmission; the biphasic release formulation provides rapid onset followed by sustained sleep maintenance.

adult.oral: 6.25–12.5 mg at bedtime; 6.25 mg recommended for women and older adults to reduce next-day impairment.

sections.text: Onset within 30 minutes; duration approximately 7–8 hours due to extended-release formulation.

other: Risk of next-day impairment, especially at 12.5 mg or if taken without a full night's sleep

sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; consider alternative or monitor infant
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity; use lowest effective dose (6.25 mg)

sections.text: Gradually taper if used longer than a few weeks to minimize withdrawal and rebound insomnia.
